poem.title: LitCrit
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
"An audience is oxygen to a poet, and the most effective way of showing your feelings is to deprive him of air" - Rita Goldberg, Harvard University
Some critics eat thristles For gristle and grace But the thirls of authority Frazzle them numb To the thrills in things. As their oxygen thins They suffocate folk Who'd not stifle a yawn.
